metadata.name: Firewall Disabled via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('firewall')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('opmode')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disable')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('advfirewall')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('state')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('off'))))

output.summary: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activity References: https://www.winhelponline.com/blog/enable-and-disable-windows-firewall-quickly-using-command-line/, https://app.any.run/tasks/210244b9-0b6b-4a2c-83a3-04bd3175d017/, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1562.004/T1562.004.md#atomic-test-1---disable-microsoft-defender-firewall
